Surrogate.definition: one acting in the place of another ;esp
Surrogate.origin: [Latin surrogatus , past participle of surrogare subrogare to substitute, from sub- in place of, under + rogare to ask]

1.definition: one acting in the place of anotherone standing in loco parentis to a child

2.definition: the judge or judicial officer of a Surrogate's Court or Surrogate's office
